intro: Hieracium gombense, commonly known as the Gombos hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It features yellowish to brownish flowers and has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems. Hieracium gombense is often found in calcareous habitats and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
